meanings.definition: Intended for or likely to be understood by only a small number of people with a specialized knowledge or interest.
meanings.sent1: The professor's esoteric lecture on quantum physics confused most of the students.
meanings.sent2: The bookshop owner had a collection of esoteric novels that only a few customers appreciated.
meanings.sent3: Trying to explain the esoteric concept of time travel to my dog was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her esoteric taste in music was like a hidden treasure waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The ancient manuscript contained esoteric symbols that intrigued the archaeologists.
